data.prayer: Lord, stir the hearts of your people in Dhekelia to agree with you and with one another.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Dhekelia, Akrotiri and Dhekelia
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Over 1 percent of the people of Dhekelia are far from Jesus. Lord, please send your gospel to them through the internet or radio or television today!
Spirit, please defend the 1,520 believers in Dhekelia against self-centered spirituality. Open their eyes to the fields ripe for harvest around them.
Jesus, remind the disciples in the state of Dhekelia to train each other to obey all that you commanded, and that you will be with them as they do it.
data.verse: and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age."

data.focus_label: Pray for the city of Xylotymbou
data.prayer: Pray that God raises up new churches in the city of Xylotymbou, Dhekelia, Akrotiri and Dhekelia.
Spirit, fill the 1,520 believers in the state of Dhekelia with tears, because God is not obeyed by those around them.
data.verse: Streams of tears flow from my eyes, for your law is not obeyed.

data.prayer: Father, please send new teachers into the harvest, who can correct the lies of our enemy in the state of Dhekelia, Akrotiri and Dhekelia.
data.verse: Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.

data.section_summary:
the state of Dhekelia, Akrotiri and Dhekelia has a population of 38,000.

We estimate Dhekelia has 1,520 people who might know Jesus, 36,100 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 380 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 24 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Please, convict the 1,520 believers in Dhekelia, Akrotiri and Dhekelia to look to you as their only hope for strength and fruitfulness and life.
data.verse: "I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.
